summary: This document is an email chain forwarding Amazon's response to a law enforcement subpoena (Case No. 20 Mag. 6216) related to the Epstein case. Amazon's representative, Teresa Rodelo, provides data but notes redactions and objections due to volume and burden.

persons.name: Teresa Rodelo
persons.role: Manager, Law Enforcement Response Team at Amazon.com, Inc.
persons.context: She is the Amazon representative who sent the company's formal response to the law enforcement subpoena, citing privacy redactions and legal objections.

events.title: Amazon Subpoena Response Submission
events.description: Amazon submits its response to a law enforcement subpoena (Case No. 20 Mag. 6216) related to the Epstein case, providing data but redacting titles of expressive materials and raising objections.

keyFacts: Amazon received and responded to a law enforcement subpoena (Case No. 20 Mag. 6216) related to the Epstein case in 2020.
Amazon redacted the titles of 'expressive materials' in its response for privacy and legal reasons.
Amazon objected to the subpoena, stating the request was 'unusually voluminous' and would cause an 'undue burden'.
The correspondence indicates law enforcement was seeking information from Amazon, possibly related to evidence for bail considerations or the investigation.
